title: Firefox 103.0.2 (64-bit) on win7 drops inet connection
content: A few weeks ago firefox started dropping inet connection while everything else is still connected fine. Closing and restarting browser also shows that previous session didn't shut down, have to close previous version, then new browser session comes up OK. Very annoying. Hardwired ethernet connection to router. Not only my win7 machine. My wifes win10 laptop on wifi just started having a similar experience with firefox. It's only firefox inet problems, not other instances of inet connection such as TV streaming or other web based services. Any suggestions? Any settings to look for?

title: Not being redirected when click on a link
content:
Hello,

When I go to www.fieldandstream.com and click on a link to be redirected, they use https://www.avantlink.com/, I get messages that server not found. Here are two messages I get:

Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site.

We can’t connect to the server at www.ojrq.net.

If that address is correct, here are three other things you can try: 

   Try again later.    Check your network connection.    If you are connected but behind a firewall, check that Firefox has permission to access the Web.

Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site.

We can’t connect to the server at www.avantlink.com.

If that address is correct, here are three other things you can try: 

   Try again later.    Check your network connection.    If you are connected but behind a firewall, check that Firefox has permission to access the Web.

title: Wrong channel selected by Firefox on multi-channel external sound card
content:
Hi, I am using Firefox 103.0.2 on a M1 Mac with an external sound card with multiple stereo outputs pairs (1-2, 3-4, etc.)

Whatever the system selection for default stereo output is (e.g., 3-4), firefox will systematically select the first output pair (1-2) of the external sound card. All other applications (Chrome, Safari, Music, etc.) output on the selected default stereo output (3-4)

I can see I am not the only one to face the problem but threads are hard to read and understand.

Thanks for your help! Theo
creator: theosafar

title: Firefox suddenly distorting passwords it's trying to save
content:
Hi, in just the past few days I've discovered that when I visit a website and set up a log-in ID and password, the password that Firefox Manager offers to save isn't being saved correctly. For example, say I use the password 143143, it saves it as something like 973973.

This has happened to me three times that I'm aware of (and I kept having to go back to Safari's saved passwords to find the correct ones, since I typically use randomly generated passwords.

I'm running macOS Mojave, 10.14.06, so I haven't changed the OS in well over a year. (I haven't updated as I have an SSD that's not APFS.) Any suggestions? Many thanks.

title: syc datas
content: Hello everyone,i lost my saved datas like history,saved password etc when i changed my gmail password which i used to syc my firefox account.I wonder why it happened because i did not tick the box asking if i want to delete them.I also used another laptop to check and the data i lost in my other laptop were there.I added secondary email as back up and clicked to change the new email to primary only for me to see my data got lost from the second laptop again.why? i tried to change the password of my first primary email back to the old password but google did not allow me.My question is,can changing back to my password back to the old one bring my lost data back? i asked because that was the password used by firefox to save my data in their server.will google ever allow me to change back to old password after sometime? what i am amazed at is that i login using other browswer with the new pasword on another laptop and i got back my syc datas.Thanks in advance for your feed back.

title: Disabling the shortcut Ctrl + I
content:
"Ctrl + I" is a universal shortcut for formatting text in italics in pretty much _every_ text editor that supports such formatting. It is very, very, _incredibly_ annoying that almost every time I use it, firefox opens "Page info". Among the websites I tried, only Google Docs are not affected. Everything else -- messengers, text boxes like this one where I'm writing this question -- they're all affected.

Is it possible to disable ctrl+i as a "Page info" shortcut? It is honestly surprising that Firefox uses it in the first place, seeing how widespread its other use is. I write texts a lot in my everyday work, and I'm seriously considering switching the browsers because of this issue, even though I like Firefox in every other aspect.
creator: ionastasi

title: Mac Bookmark dialogue box issue
content:
When I select "Add Bookmark" from the Bookmark dropdown menu on the menu bar, the popup menu to select the location (folder) to place the bookmark quickly flashes open and closed. The bookmark is created, but it is created in the last place that a bookmark was added. If I am still on that tab and I try to use "Edit Bookmark" from the menu bar to open the pop up it also just flashes up and closes.

If I move away from that tab to another one, and then come back to it, the "Edit Bookmark is not even listed as an option."

Can you please assist.



/edit: moved thread from Firefox for iOS (for iPhone/iPad) to Firefox section as you have macOS<b/b>.
creator: ric9

title: Twitch Chat Collapses
content: When I go to windowed mode on Twitch. Chat automatically collapses. I was able to reproduce the problem in troubleshoot mode. I tried to reproduce it in Chrome and didn't get the error. The only way to fix this is to bring Firefox into window mode, make chat un-collapse, and then bring it back to full screen. I am using version 103.0.2 (64-bit).

useragent_locale: en-US

This report also contains technical information about the state of the application when it crashed.
creator: robotwizard

title: Bookmark Spacing
content:
Why did you choose to waste desktop space with so much white space between Bookmarks? I use Firefox because the bookmarks can be arranged on the left pane and I can quickly access hundreds of frequently visited web sites without having to use the scroll bar.

I have been designing user interfaces for over 25 years and cannot understand the reason for this. It is not any easier to read and much less productive and more time consuming. To be as productive as I was with the older versions, I need twice as much vertical space. The Bookmark setup was the biggest advantage to Firefox and why we were using it.

I am also extremely disappointed that you did away with the colors for folders. The empty white outline makes it more difficult to read. If the Folders were colored and the white space was eliminated, we could fit twice as many bookmarks and with much improved readability.

It is not cool or fancy or trendy - it is much worse than the older interface.
creator: Stride85

title: Addons and themes no longer downloading
content: ever since the latest update to my firefox browser, every time i go to download a theme or addon it says "Installation aborted because the add-on appears to be corrupt." every single addon even featured ones do this, so does themes. is there a way i can fix this?
creator: kittybuttertins04

title: Mcafee web advisor
content: I have Windows 11 and I can't get Mcafee Web Advisor added onto Firefox add-ons. When I download the Web Advisor from Mcafee website and I try to open the file I get a message that says the file is corrupt. I'm elderly and need simple instructions on how to get this added onto my Firefox.
creator: secretaryinvestigations

title: Not working properly
content:
I am having a lot of issues with Firefox 103.0.2. When I open tabs I'm getting connection issues, if I open a new tab to search, I am getting the same message. I also am now having printing issues directly from Firefox only. It isn't printing mailing labels correctly, logos are huge and you can only see a portion of them. This all started with the newest update of Firefox. Everything was working fine before. I have tried printing the same label through Safari and Chrome and it works fine so not a printer issue. I am on a Mac Mini MacOS Catalina 10.15.7. I have tried deleting the app and reinstalling, clearing cache and history, restarting my computer, working offline but nothing helps.



/edit: moved from Firefox for iOS (for iPhone/iPad) to Firefox section as you have macOS.
creator: pattibca

title: cant access Kroger shopping web site login page
content: cant log in to my kroger webpage to shop, says to disable any pop up or ad blockers yet in settings the block pop up windows is unchecked? I can use Edge and get right in, so why are you making it difficult?
creator: topazblue330ci
